intro: Phycella, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and showy, blue or purple flower heads. These plants are typically found in coastal regions and saline soils, adapting to harsh maritime environments. Phycella species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging conditions. Their growth habits and ecological roles make them important components of coastal ecosystems.
